body:
<!-- **Are you in the right place?**
1. For issues or feature requests, please create an issue in this repository.
2. For general technical and non-technical questions, we are happy to help you on our [Rook.io Slack](https://slack.rook.io/).
3. Did you already search the existing open issues for anything similar? -->

**Is this a bug report or feature request?**
* Bug Report

**Deviation from expected behavior:**
When creating a new cluster, job rook-ceph-csi-detect-version never completes successfully, so the cluster creation never progresses. 

I can work around this by creating the configmap manually: 
```
kubectl exec -ti -n rook-ceph rook-ceph-operator-5c89b7dc94-52sxf -- cat /var/lib/rook/rook-ceph/rook-ceph.config > rook-ceph.config
kubectl create cm -n rook-ceph rook-ceph-csi-config --from-file=rook-ceph.config
```

However, this does not appear to contain the correct data or formatting, because subsequent attempts to create a pvc stay in pending, and no csi pods are created. 

**Expected behavior:**
rook-ceph-csi-detect-version should write the config file 

**How to reproduce it (minimal and precise):**
<!-- Please let us know any circumstances for reproduction of your bug. -->
Create a new cluster on k3s, Raspberry Pi 4, aarch64. 
```
git clone --single-branch --branch release-1.3 https://github.com/rook/rook.git
cd rook/cluster/examples/kubernetes/ceph
kubectl create -f common.yaml
kubectl create -f operator.yaml
kubectl create -f cluster.yaml
```

**File(s) to submit**:

* Cluster CR (custom resource), typically called `cluster.yaml`, if necessary
unmodified cluster.yaml from 1.3 branch
* Operator's logs, if necessary

* Crashing pod(s) logs, if necessary

 To get logs, use `kubectl -n <namespace> logs <pod name>`
When pasting logs, always surround them with backticks or use the `insert code` button from the Github UI.
Read [Github documentation if you need help](https://help.github.com/en/articles/creating-and-highlighting-code-blocks).

**Environment**:
* OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release):

NAME="Raspbian GNU/Linux"
VERSION_ID="10"
VERSION="10 (buster)"
VERSION_CODENAME=buster

ID_LIKE=debian

Pi 4 4GB
* Rook version (use `rook version` inside of a Rook Pod):
rook: v1.3.4
go: go1.13.8

* Storage backend version (e.g. for ceph do `ceph -v`):
ceph version 14.2.9 (581f22da52345dba46ee232b73b990f06029a2a0) nautilus (stable)

k3s
* Storage backend status (e.g. for Ceph use `ceph health` in the [Rook Ceph toolbox](https://rook.io/docs/rook/master/ceph-toolbox.html)):
title: rook ceph operator fails to write rook-ceph-csi-config configmap
